com.google.gwt.dev.util
Class Util

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.dev.util.Util

public final class Util
extends java.lang.Object

A smattering of useful methods. Methods in this class are candidates for being moved to Utility if they would be generally useful to tool writers, and don't involve TreeLogger.

escapeXml

public static java.lang.String escapeXml(java.lang.String unescaped)
Escapes '&', '<', '>', '"', and '\'' to their XML entity equivalents.

escapeXml

public static void escapeXml(java.lang.String code,
                             int start,
                             int end,
                             boolean quoteApostrophe,
                             java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
Escapes '&', '<', '>', '"', and optionally ''' to their XML entity equivalents. The portion of the input string between start (inclusive) and end (exclusive) is scanned. The output is appended to the given StringBuilder.

Parameters:
code - the input String
start - the first character position to scan.
end - the character position following the last character to scan.
quoteApostrophe - if true, the ' character is quoted as &apos;
builder - a StringBuilder to be appended with the output.

getResourceModifiedTime

public static long getResourceModifiedTime(java.net.URL url)
Retrieves the last modified time of a provided URL.

Returns:
a positive value indicating milliseconds since the epoch (00:00:00 Jan 1, 1970), or 0L on failure, such as a SecurityException or IOException.

recursiveDelete

public static void recursiveDelete(java.io.File file,
                                   boolean childrenOnly)
Deletes a file or recursively deletes a directory.

Parameters:
file - the file to delete, or if this is a directory, the directory that serves as the root of a recursive deletion
childrenOnly - if true, only the children of a directory are recursively deleted but the specified directory itself is spared; if false, the specified directory is also deleted; ignored if file is not a directory

recursiveDelete

public static void recursiveDelete(java.io.File file,
                                   boolean childrenOnly,
                                   java.io.FileFilter filter)
Selectively deletes a file or recursively deletes a directory. Note that it is possible that files remain if file.delete() fails.

Parameters:
file - the file to delete, or if this is a directory, the directory that serves as the root of a recursive deletion
childrenOnly - if true, only the children of a directory are recursively deleted but the specified directory itself is spared; if false, the specified directory is also deleted; ignored if file is not a directory
filter - only files matching this filter will be deleted

recursiveListPartialPaths

public static java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.String> recursiveListPartialPaths(java.io.File parent,
                                                                              boolean includeDirs)
Recursively lists a directory, returning the partial paths of the child files.

Parameters:
parent - the directory to start from
includeDirs - whether or not to include directories in the results
Returns:
all partial paths descending from the parent file

stripJarPathPrefix

public static java.lang.String stripJarPathPrefix(java.lang.String absolutePath)
Remove leading file:jar:...!/ prefix from source paths for source located in jars.

Parameters:
absolutePath - an absolute JAR file URL path
Returns:
the location of the file within the JAR

takeThreadLocalBuf

public static byte[] takeThreadLocalBuf()
Get a large byte buffer local to this thread. Currently this is set to a 16k buffer, which is small enough to fit into the L2 cache on modern processors. The contents of the returned buffer are undefined. Calling releaseThreadLocalBuf(byte[]) on the returned buffer allows subsequent callers to reuse the buffer later, avoiding unncessary allocations and GC.

toArray

public static <T> T[] toArray(java.lang.Class<? super T> componentType,
                              java.util.Collection<? extends T> coll)
Creates an array from a collection of the specified component type and size. You can definitely downcast the result to T[] if T is the specified component type. Class is used to allow creation of generic types, such as Map.Entry since we can only pass in Map.Entry.class.

toArrayReversed

public static <T> T[] toArrayReversed(java.lang.Class<? super T> componentType,
                                      java.util.Collection<? extends T> coll)
Like toArray(Class, Collection), but the option of having the array reversed.

public static java.lang.String toHexString(byte[] bytes)

Returns a string representation of the byte array as a series of hexadecimal characters.

Parameters:
bytes - byte array to convert
Returns:
a string representation of the byte array as a series of hexadecimal characters

writeUtf8

public static void writeUtf8(java.lang.StringBuilder builder,
                             java.io.OutputStream out)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Writes the contents of a StringBuilder to an OutputStream, encoding each character using the UTF-* encoding. Unicode characters between U+0000 and U+10FFFF are supported.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
